Package net.alantea.horizon.message

This package contains a pretty simple messaging mechanism between objects in Java.

See: Description

Package net.alantea.horizon.message Description

This package contains a pretty simple messaging mechanism between objects in Java. Any object (mainly those implementing the MessageSubscriber interface) may send a message to any other object (preferred is MessageSubscriber object), using the method : sender.sendMessage(MessageSubscriber receiver, String id, Object content); if it is an MessageSubscriber, or one of the Messenger.sendMessage(...) methods.

The receiver will receive an HorizonMessage through one of the three following mechanism :
A - Search for a receiver method marked as @Listen with the corresponding Identifier and call it.

B - If the receiver class - or one of its ancestors - has declared a method onXxxxMessage(HorizonMessage message), with Xxxx being the Id of the sent message, then this method is called.
C - If no corresponding method exists, then the default receiver method onMessage(HorizonMessage message) is searched for and called.

Messages are sent asynchronously and processed one after one, in a specialized thread. This thread is a daemon, thus it will stop, regardless of the remaining messages, as soon as the main thread stops.

Author:
Jean Rébillat
